title: Change a Tire
content: I'm alone Stanley for howdini calm and in this segment we'll be talking about changing a flat tire certainly it's inconvenient but we're going to walk you through it step by step lift up this cover to access the spare tire well on loosen it go to hold down then give it a couple good wrap make sure it's full of air worst thing you want to do is put on a flat spare then you'll remove the tire careful this can be quite heavy well we have our spare tire in our Jack we've set our reflective warning signal out we've also dropped the wheel on the opposite side of the flat tire so we're ready to start changing it the first thing we'll do is jack the vehicle up you'll have to loosen the jack a little bit in order to get the handle off this particular model has the lug wrench built right in before we Jack though we'd want to loosen the lug nuts because once it's jacked up it's going to be very difficult to get those lug nuts off this particular model has a hubcap which will just loosen those up doesn't take much because they're made out of plastic set the hub cap out of the way now you have access to the lug nuts loosen the lug nuts position yourself firmly pressing counterclockwise loosen the lug nuts not too loose just enough to crack them this is a little stubborn position yourself over using your knee or your foot you can gain leverage now we're ready to jack it up this is the common scissors jack the screw moves in and out allowing the mechanism to move up and down and lift your car so as you turn it to the right it'll go up as you loosen it the jack will collapse allowing the car to come down now we'll position the jack you want to be sure to get the jack on a good part of the frame your owner's manuals a good place to find where to properly jack the vehicle you can raise it up by hand until it contacts the frame it is in good position we use the jack handle to raise the vehicle insert the end of the jack handle into the jack using it as leverage it'll help make the car go up easier remember to turn it clockwise to go up and counterclockwise to go down carefully Jack the car up never stick your hands or your legs under the vehicle as the car can fall and cause damage checking can take a while so be patient and cautious as you jack okay now that the car is jacked up now we'll take the lug nuts loose remembered we already pre loosened them when the car was on the ground making it easy you notice they'll come right off now trying to do that while a car was jacked up would be very difficult remember to keep your lug nuts in closed hands you don't want them rolling away in the grass because it'll be hard to find and that's what holds your tire on again we're turning them counterclockwise to get them loose or to the left we'll remove the flat tire set it over here out of the way now if there was heavy traffic area you wouldn't want to leave it in the street you might want to put it to the rear of the car grab the spare tire put it in position you're going to Center the spare tire on the wheel studs that's where the lug nuts go so go ahead and do that lining it up you see it lines up pretty easy then install your lug nuts again clockwise just tight counterclockwise is loose so we'll tighten them up by hand as far as they'll go once the tire centered lug nuts are hand tight take the lug wrench again turning it clockwise tighten the lugs till they're firm not too tight because remember your car is up on a jack we wouldn't want it falling off with too much leverage of force insert the jack handle back into the jack turning it counterclockwise again we're going to lower the vehicle again this will take some time but going downs a lot of user than going up if he seems to be going down easy you can just do it like this by doing it straight instead of having it angled but if it's too tough you can angle it and get the leverage that you'll need to lower the jack or to raise the jack turn the jack lower enough you can do it by hand now that it doesn't have contact with the frame and we can remove it now let the tires on the ground we'll go ahead and give them that final type and we're going to start down here then move to the top one then back down over and back again a little star pattern making sure we have equal torque on the wheel studs okay well we have our spare tire on it's aired up we're ready to go a couple things to remember though is you want to put everything back in the trunk you don't want to exceed highway speed on this temporary spare make sure you get the big tire fixed and you'll get you back on the road as soon as possible I'm Alan Stanley for howdini dot-com you

title: Change a Tire
content: hello there youtubers this is Paul here today I'm gonna show you how to change the spare tire on the 2015 Nissan Micra in the event of a flat tire the first thing you'll want to do is pull your micro safely off the road set your parking brake and turn on the hazards the four-way flashers and turn the car off you know you want to find something to block one of the good tires with so that the car doesn't roll the parking brake now the first question you might ask yourself either looking for is where is the spare tire well Nissan in order to create more space in the trunk has decided to put the spare tire under the car so I'm gonna show you how we get the spare tire yeah so the way we get the spare tire down is by turning this pull the spare tire sits in a cage and now the tool we're going to use is there's this extender on the bolt and then we're going to use the tire iron wrench I'm gonna turn it counterclockwise several turns to lower okay so you want to turn it enough times approximately 15 full turns so that you can get this part of the wire cage up and over the lip of the clamp now this is a piece of hardware you will want to keep an eye on you want to keep it oiled and clean during the winter months to prevent corrosion I'm just gonna go ahead and drop that after you taking the spare tire out it's a probably good idea to put this cage back up and tighten that bolt up above so that you don't have this cage rattling around us now make sure that when you Jack this car up you place the jack at one of the reinforced jacking points here they're easy to find they're located between two there's one in behind each the four tires we have the tools that we need to change the tire that came supplied with the micro if you need to you can remove the hubcap with this tool here it has a flattened edge I'm not gonna worry about it because my hubcaps have left my bolts exposed and now to use a jack in the by turning the bolts just enough so that we can easily take it off we're going to remove this for safety as well and once they're loose you can just spin them over to fingers if you want tire iron the tool has ridges on there for removing the security yeah flat tire and then we put the spare tire on and we'll put the bolts on finger tight I never like to work in a fashion where the next bolt I would put it would be across from the first one I put in just to make sure that everything goes on equally so just finger tight for now so of that one then that one then I'm gonna do these two here and then my security bolt I'm just going to give these a little little bit of a turn just snug them up they're not I'm not parking them down yeah and just just working around torquing them just setting them up okay and again I should work in the when I do one tighten the one up the cross from it and then I'll come over here and they'll tighten the one up across from it like that just bring the jack down so that this tire is just touching the ground and we'll do a counterclockwise fashion okay so now our tires touching the ground so I'll go ahead and I'll put a lot more force on these balls in the car down the rest of the way now the original tire will not fit in that wire cage only the spare tire tire okay now just to know once you've had your tire repaired and you're ready to put the spare tire back under the car remember that this side here with the valve stem duct goes up if you put this in upside down it's not gonna sit in there right and it's gonna rattle around possibly cause some damage so make sure you put it on this way around and make sure that you line this hub up this piece right here a rubber thing on it to keep it from rattling around and banging around and that's it it's very simple and easy to do and a very very good design too I might add thanks for watching

title: Change a Tire
content: brought to you by 1a auto calm your source for quality parts and the best service on the internet hi I'm Mike from 1a auto I hope this how-to video helps you out and next time you need parts for your vehicle think of 1a auto calm Thanks hi I'm Tony with 1a auto and today we're going to show you how to change a flat tire with your spare on a 1998 Toyota Camry before changing your tire you'll want to make sure that the vehicle is on flat solid ground to the best of your ability make sure your hazard lights are on the parking brake set and the vehicle is in park and always be aware of your surroundings if you don't feel that you can replace the tire safely be sure to call an emergency service company to have them tow the vehicle or take care of the tire for you before jacking up the vehicle to change your tire be sure to chalk the wheel if you don't keep a chop block or block of wood in the vehicle look around for a large stick or rock or something to support the wheel you can shock any wheel that's not going to be raised up when you jack up the vehicle our recommendation is the opposite side on the same axle chalk your wheel at the front if the nose of the vehicle is facing downhill or at the rear if the back of the vehicle is facing downhill move your carpet unscrew the hold-down for your trunk liner remove your trunk liner remove your tools from their retainers tire iron jack handle unscrew your spare tire and remove it from the vehicle remove the cover on the passenger side of the trunk floor lower your jack by hand to release it from its retainer remove the hubcap from the wheel simply by grabbing hold pulling out use your tire iron to break all of your lug nuts loose before jacking up the vehicle once your lugs are loose you want to do your best to have the vehicle on a hard flat surface before you start this process but if you can't be on a hard surface you'll want to carry a block of board with you to support your Jack with put your jack on the ground or your block of wood this notch here is designed to sit onto the pinch weld under the vehicle fastest raise it up by hand then install your jack handle crank the vehicle up the rest of the way make sure you bring the vehicle up high enough that the new tire will go on without hitting the ground before it gets onto the hub use your tire iron to remove your lug nuts the rest of the way remove the tire from the hub place the tire under the vehicle is a safety in case something happens and the jack fails of the vehicles knocked off the jack this will catch it and keep you in the vehicle from being hurt and damaged inspect the condition of your spare tire make sure that there are no wear marks around the sidewall at the tires inflated properly that the tread is in good condition reinstall the wheel onto the hub and start your lug nuts by hand remove the tire from under the vehicle lower your jack until the wheel just touches the ground with partial weight on the vehicle tighten your lug nuts the rest of the way and a cross pattern with the lug nuts tightened bring the jack down the rest of the way once it's off the vehicle you can bring it down by hand goes a little bit faster remove your block of wood with the full weight on the vehicle check your lug nuts one more time just to be sure remember to always go on a cross pattern here with your hubcap where this is a full-size spare we don't have to worry about mileage or top speed it's going to be the same as the tire we've removed find the notch and your hubcap and align it put the valve stem on the wheel tap the hub cap into place to reinstall your Jack place it into its holder line up the notch with this tab here spin the jack open so let's secure reinstall your cover since we have a full-size spare tire we can secure the bad tire back underneath the floor liner line up the hold-down with a threaded hole on the floor pan and screw your spare tire down tight reinstall your tools into the trunk liner stall the trunk liner and screw it down reinstall your trunk liner thanks for tuning in we hope this video helped you out next time you need parts for your car please visit 1a auto calm also check out our other helpful how-to as well as diagnosis videos

title: Change a Tire
content: when you notice you have a puncture do not continue driving your Toyota as this can rapidly damage both the tire and wheel stop your car safely on a firm level surface away from traffic if possible if needed set up a warning triangle and turn on the hazard lights apply the parking brake and put the vehicle in park or first gear so the car doesn't accidentally move switch off the ignition and ensure that all passengers safely exit the vehicle you'll find the spare wheel and replacement tools in the trunk the tools include a jack for raising the vehicle and a wrench to take off the nuts that attach the wheel to the car if the wheel has a hubcap used the tool provided to remove it before jacking up the vehicle use the wrench to loosen the nuts 1/2 to 1 turn these should be quite tight if you don't have the strength to loosen them by hand try using your foot next you need to jack up the car search the underside of the vehicle to find the jacking point closest to the wheel you want to replace if you can't find it check the owner's manual never put any object or any part of your body under the vehicle when using the jack once the jack is in place jack up the vehicle until the flat tire easily clears the road you can then remove all the wheel nuts and the flat tire do not touch the disk wheels or the area around the brakes as they can be extremely hot lift the spare wheel onto the hub and make sure the holes are lined up then replace the wheel nuts tightening them until they're firm lower the jack until the spare wheel touches the ground then using the wrench tighten the wheel nuts firmly in sequence once this is done lower the car completely remove the jack and put it and the tools in their proper place put the flat tire somewhere handy so you can have it fixed and replaced by a Toyota repairer if you cannot do this soon check the wheel nuts after a couple of hundred kilometers of driving to make sure they're still tight remember not to exceed 80 km/h when driving with a compact spare wheel at the Toyota authorized repairer you'll receive expert assistance and the best possible care for your Toyota insuring that your driving experience remains safe and pleasurable

title: Change a Tire
content: here's hoping you'll never have to but just in case let's talk about changing a flat tire the jack and spare tire are both stowed under an access cover in the cargo area remove the hold down securing the spare tire now you can remove the spare tire in jacking tools turn the jack screw to the left to loosen the lug wrench and remove the wrench from the jack assembly now loosen but do not remove the wheel lug nuts by turning them to the left one turn while the wheel is still on the ground make sure you're parked on a firm level surface safely away from traffic avoid ice or slippery areas also make sure the ignition is off the hazard lights are on and the parking brake is fully set blocking both the front and rear of the wheel diagonally opposite of the jacking position is also a good idea for example if changing the right front tire block the left rear tire there are front and rear jacking locations on each side of the body the front locations are outlined by two triangular cutouts the rear locations by two rectangular cutouts do not raise the vehicle until you are sure the jack is fully engaged now you're ready to raise the vehicle by turning the jack screw to the right raise the vehicle only until the tire just clears the surface and enough clearance is obtained to install the spare tire remember minimum tire lift provides maximum stability okay now go ahead and remove the lug nuts and wheel position the spare tire on the vehicle with the valve stem facing out the vehicle could be damaged if the spare tire is mounted incorrectly reinstall the lug nuts with the cone-shaped end toward the wheel lightly tighten the lug nuts clockwise now you can lower the vehicle by turning the jack screw to the left and remove the jack once on the ground you can finish tightening the lug nuts alternate lug nuts until each lug nut has been tightened twice maximum effort should be used for final tightening of the lug nuts it's always a good idea to have the tightness checked with a torque wrench by your authorized dealer or at a service station now just secure the tire jack and tools in their proper locations remove blocks from the wheels and you're ready to go please refer to the instruction manuals on the owners information DVD or Jeep comm slash owners for complete details and other important safety information

title: Change a Tire
content: so you have a flat tire not to worry changing it is easy and only takes a few minutes first make sure your emergency brake is engaged this will prevent the vehicle from rolling next locate your spare and Jack these can usually be found in the trunk lay out your tools so they're easy to reach locate the pinch weld for the body and frame meat slide the jack underneath and raise it until it touches the weld [Music] loosen the lug nuts just a bit then jack up the car make sure the tire has completely lifted off the ground now remove the lug nuts and the flat tire [Music] put on the spare and replace the lug nuts lower the car until the tire makes contact with the ground tighten the nuts in a star pattern this ensures that the tire goes on straight drop the car down the rest of the way and you're good to go [Music] remember engage the ebrake place the jack under the pinch weld make sure the tire has cleared the ground and tighten the lug nuts in a star pattern for more tips visit youtube.com slash onto west TV [Music]

content: hi sam here from subaru Australia and thanks for joining us again on our between services videos in this episode I'm going to show you what you do when you happen to come across a deflated tire on your Subaru having a deflated tire is at best an inconvenience but if you're driving when this occurs it could be dangerous you may notice a sudden change in the handling and the stability of the car and if that's the case here's my advice never ever break suddenly always try and drive mostly straight ahead and slow the vehicle speed gradually pull off the road safely and out of harm's way on a flat level surface turn on your hazard lights and engage the parking brake select mutual gear in and manual or engage parking and automatic and turn off the engine before you get out of the car be sure to check it safe to do so and do a walk-around inspection of the vehicle in this case it's the front right that's flat so we need to change the tire when we're doing that the original jacking equipment is the best tool for the job we do need to chock the other wheels while we jack up the car and here's where we need to get a little bit ingenious I'm going to use these blocks but if I was on the side of the road I'd probably try and find a couple of rocks to chop the rear wheel with once we've done that we need to make sure the occupants are out of the car so get the family up but make sure they're in a nice safe location away from the road and when the car is jacked up don't go putting your body parts underneath while it's supported by the jack how do we access the tools for this well we open the tailgate or the boot and we get the jack the handle the tire wrench and the spare wheel so now I've got all the tools and the spare wheel out of the boot I've chopped the diagonally opposite will like it tells me to in the owners manual first thing I need to do is loosen the wheel nuts so at this point I'm not actually undoing the nuts I'm just loosening them and now I've done that will install the jack under the seal but please refer to your owners manual for the correct location and then we can jack up the car so normally I'd raise the vehicle up about 40 or 50 mil above where the tire sits just so I good enough room to fit the new tire on now we just remove the wheel nuts take the wheel off the car put the new one on just be careful when you're doing this so as these wheel nuts could be hot after driving the car sending an important step is to check if there's any debris on the wheel hub but before we do that these are all brake components and they're likely to be hot if you've been driving the car so while you're inspecting that please don't touch them if this area is all clean we'll install in your wheel and then the wheel nuts by hand and tighten them up with the wrench once you've done that then we'll lower the car down off the jack and then retention the wheel nuts using the wrench correctly now we've done that we just need to put all this gear in the boot of the car in its correct location when you've got the next opportunity cool into your subaru service center to not only get the tire replaced but also have your wheel nuts checked by technician using the correct equipment don't forget if you don't have a full size spare like this car and you've got a temporary spare you need to pay particular attention to the revised speed limit

title: Change a Tire
content: hi my name is Ralph and I'm a service technician at David mas Toyota and today I'd like to show you how to change your vehicle's tire in the event of a flat this particular vehicles spare tire is located in the rear of the hatch to access it we need to open up the back latch compartment where you'll find your spare tire and all the tools that you will need to change your flat fire remove these covers from the vehicle so you'll be able to remove the tire once these covers all remove we should be able to remove the spare tire easily in this vehicle the jack is located in the same compartment with the spare tire remove the locking mechanism on the side which is in this case a rubber band which hooks into this piece of plastic here pull that to the side and slightly unscrew the tensioner and you can remove the jack after that the jack tools and spare tire lug nut tool is located to the right of the spare tire in this vehicle on this particular vehicle the lifting location is located just to the front of the rear tire on the bottom of the rocker pannel is an arrow which will show you the location of the jack when lifting the vehicle the jack should be put on the pinch weld so it does not slide out check to make sure that the jack is still located on the pinch weld after the vehicle starts to race once you've accomplished that proceed by lifting the vehicle slowly make sure that you have firm ground to place the jack on before you start the jacking procedure while the tire is still touching the ground remove the hubcap and loosen the lug nuts slightly when the lug nuts are loosened slightly you can continue to raise the vehicle at this point we can remove the lug nuts by hand carefully remove the tire from the vehicle your spare tire is now ready to install proper pressure for spare tires is located on the sidewall every maintenance visit that you accomplish you need to make sure that the tire pressure is filled properly install the spare onto the lug studs and start by just catching the lug nuts onto the threads spin the nuts to the rim of the tire so that they are snug by hand and then grab your lug nut tool and snug slightly at this point we could lower the vehicle down so that the tire is just touching the ground take your lug nut tool and retighten the nuts using about 50% of your body's weight changing a flat tire there's a simple test that can be done but it needs to be done safely it is important that you look at your vehicles on your mat owner's manual to make sure that you're doing the operation correctly and safely

title: Change a Tire
content: here's hoping you'll never have to but just in case let's talk about changing a flat tire the jack and jack tools are stored under the front passenger seat to access the jack and jack tools you must remove the plastic access cover located on the side of the seat to remove the cover pull the front part of the cover closest to the front of the seat toward you to release a locking tab once the front of the cover is loose slide the cover toward the front of the seat until it is free from the seat frame remove the jack and tools by removing the wing bolt and sliding the assembly from under the seat remove the spare tire before attempting to jack up the truck attach the wheel wrench to the Jack extension tube insert the tube through the access hole between the lower tailgate and the top of the bumper and into the winch mechanism tube rotate the wheel wrench handle counterclockwise until the spare tire is on the ground with enough cable slack to allow you to pull it out from under the vehicle when the spare is clear tilt the retainer at the end of the cable and pull it through the center of the wheel now loosen but do not remove the wheel lug nuts by turning them to the left one turn while the wheel is still on the ground now make sure you're parked on a firm level surface safely away from traffic avoid ice or slippery areas also make sure the ignition is off the hazard lights are on and the parking brake is fully set blocking both the front and rear of the tire diagonally opposite of the jacking position is also a good idea for example if changing the right front tire block the left rear tire do not raise the vehicle until you are sure that jack is fully engaged now you're ready to raise the vehicle by turning the jack screw to the right raise the vehicle only until the tire just clears the surface and enough clearance is obtained to install the spare tire remember minimum tire lift provides maximum stability okay now go ahead and remove the lug nuts and wheel position the spare tire on the vehicle making sure the valve stem is facing out the vehicle could be damaged if the spare tire is mounted incorrectly now reinstall the lug nuts with shaped and toured the wheel lightly tighten the lug nuts clockwise now you can lower the vehicle by turning the jack screw to the left and remove the jack once on the ground you can finish tightening the lug nuts alternate lug nuts until each lug nut has been tightened twice maximum efforts should be used for the final tightening of the lug nuts it's always a good idea to have the tightness checked with a torque wrench by your authorized dealer or at a service station now just secure the tire jack and tools in their proper locations and you're ready to go please refer to the instruction manuals on the owners information DVD or Ram trucks comm /en slash owners slash manuals for complete details and other important safety information

title: Change a Tire
content: make sure your vehicle is parked in a safe location a low traffic parking lot or large pave pull out well off any busy street or road is ideal set the emergency brake first if you have a manual transmission put your car in first gear if your vehicle is an automatic just put it in park next place wheel chocks or big rocks behind and in front of the tire opposite the one being changed this will prevent vehicle movement and the jack from slipping while we work next find your lug wrench jack and spare tire these tools are often located in the trunk under the carpeting your vehicle's manual will indicate exactly where they are this only applies if your vehicle has a hubcap many hubcaps just snap into place but some are held on by the lug nuts you can usually pry them off using something flat like a screwdriver if your vehicle has covers over the lug nuts be sure to remove them as well loosen the first lug nut by rotating the wrench counterclockwise just once without removing the lug nut entirely then loosen the second nut directly opposite of the first one and then the one opposite that like a star-shaped pattern if the lug nuts are tight use your body weight to push down look in your owners manual for where to position the jack it's often under the frame near the tire with the flat but not always the case our jack should be aligned with a thin seam line that runs under the vehicle the factory jack has a notch cut out of it for a specific fit next insert the handle and turn it clockwise to raise the car lower the jack if at any point your car seems unstable and never ever get under a car that is only supported by a jack now fully remove the lug nuts and place them in a secure location grasp the tire with two hands and pull it straight out then place it under the car this is a precautionary measure just in case the jack slips remove any aftermarket accessories like hub rings at this point the valve stem on the spare tire should be facing out then align it with the wheel studs and push it into the assembly tighten one lug nut by hand follow the same star pattern used to remove the lug nuts remove the flat tire from underneath the vehicle turn the Jack handle counterclockwise and lower the vehicle once the vehicle is firmly grounded fully tighten the lug nuts using your wrench again in the star shaped pattern remember to gather your tools back in place remove the wheel Chuck's and place your flat tire in the trunk lug nuts and lug bolts should be torqued to factory specs you can also reach out to a local discount tire for proper title: Change a Tire
content: here's hoping you'll never have to but just in case let's talk about changing a flat tire the jack and lug wrench are located in the rear storage compartment to remove the spare tire from the carrier remove the tire cover if equipped and remove the lug nuts with the lug wrench by turning them counterclockwise now you can loosen but do not remove the wheel lug nuts by turning them to the left one turn while the wheel is still on the ground make sure you're parked on a firm level surface avoid ice or slippery areas also make sure the ignition is off the hazard lights are on and the parking brake is fully set blocking both the front and rear of the wheel diagonally opposite of a jacking position is also a good idea if changing the right front tire block the left rear tire you'll need to assemble the jack and jacking tools by connecting the jack handle driver to the extension then to the lug wrench carefully place the jack under the front or rear axle tube as shown do not raise the vehicle until you are sure that jack is fully engaged now you're ready to raise the vehicle by turning the jack screw to the right raise the vehicle only until the tire just clears the surface and enough clearance is obtained to install the spare tire remember minimum tire lift provides maximum stability okay now go ahead and remove the lug nuts and wheel position the spare tire on the vehicle and reinstall the lug nuts with the cone-shaped end toward the wheel lightly tighten the lug nuts clockwise now you can lower the vehicle by turning the jack screw to the left and remove the jack once on the ground you can finish tightening the lug nuts alternate lug nuts until each lug nut has been tightened twice maximum efforts should be used for final tightening of the lug nuts it's always a good idea to have the tightness checked with a torque wrench by your authorized dealer or at a service station now just secure the tire jack and tools in their proper locations and you're ready to go please refer to the instruction manuals on the owners information DVD or Jeep comm slash owners for complete details and other important safety information

title: Change a Tire
content: here's hoping you'll never have to but just in case let's talk about changing a flat tire the scissor type Jack and tire changing tools are located in the rear cargo area below the load floor rotate the thumb screw on the jack to loosen the assembly and remove the jack from the bracket the spare tire is stowed underneath the rear of the vehicle and is held in place by a cable winch mechanism fit the jack handle extension over the drive nut located under a plastic cover at the center rear of the cargo floor area just inside the lift gate opening use the lug wrench to rotate the nut counter clockwise until the spare tire is on the ground with enough slack in the cable to allow you to pull the tire out from under the vehicle when the spare is clear pull the metal stamping toward you until you can rotate the metal stamping and push it through the hole in the plastic plate and wheel now pinch the three short and two long tubes to remove the protective plate from the steel spare wheel now loosen but do not remove the wheel lug nuts by turning them to the left one turn while the wheel is still on the ground make sure your parking a firm level surface avoid ice or slippery areas also make sure the ignition is off the hazard lights are on and the parking brake is fully set blocking both the front and rear of the wheel diagonally opposite of a jacking position is also a good idea if changing the right front tire block the left rear tire assemble the cover on top of the jack and attach the lug wrench to the jack tool with the hook for the front axle place the jack and protective cap on the body flange just behind the front tire as indicated by the triangular lift point symbol on the sill molding for a rear tire place the jack and protective cap on the flange rearward of the hoist rear tie-down bracket just forward of the rear tire as indicated by the triangular lift point symbol on the sill molding do not raise the vehicle until you are sure the jack is fully engaged now you're ready to raise the vehicle by turning the Jack screw to the right raise the vehicle only until the tire just clears the surface and enough clearance is obtained to install the spare tire remember minimum tire lift provides maximum stability okay now go ahead and remove the lug nuts and wheel position the spare tire on the vehicle and reinstall the lug nuts with the cone shaped end toward the wheel lightly tighten the lug nuts clockwise now you can lower the vehicle by turning the jack screw to the left once on the ground you can finish tightening the lug nuts alternate lug nuts until each lug nut has been tightened twice maximum efforts should be used for final tightening of the lug nuts it's always a good idea to have the tightness checked with a torque wrench by your authorized dealer or at a service station now just secure the tire jack and tools in their proper locations remove blocks from the wheels and you're ready to go please refer to the instruction manuals on the owners information DVD or dodge comm slash owners for complete details and other important safety formation

floor use the hook to hold the load floor up and out of the way remove the jacking tools and the wing nut securing the spare tire now you can remove the spare tire now loosen but do not remove the wheel bolts by turning them to the left one turn while the wheel is still on the ground make sure you're parked on a firm level surface safely away from traffic avoid ice or slippery areas also make sure the ignition is off the hazard lights are on and the parking brake is fully set blocking both the front and rear of the wheel diagonally opposite of the jacking position is also a good idea if changing the right front tire block the left rear tire place the jack underneath the lift area that is closest to the flat tire the front locations are outlined by two triangular cutouts the rear locations by two rectangular cutouts do not raise the vehicle until you are sure that jack is fully engaged now you're ready to raise the vehicle by turning the jackscrew to the right raise the jackscrew to the left and remove the jack once on the ground you can finish tightening the wheel bolts alternate wheel bolts until each one has been tightened twice maximum effort should be used for final tightening of the wheel bolts it's always a good idea to have the tightness checked with a torque wrench by your authorized dealer or at a service station now just secure the tire jack and tools details and other important safety information

title: Change a Tire
content: here's hoping you'll never have to but just in case let's talk about changing a flat tire the jack and spare tire are both stowed under an access cover in the cargo area remove the hold down securing the spare tire now you can remove the spare tire and jacking tools turn the jacks drew to the left to loosen the lug wrench and remove the wrench from the jack assembly now loosen but do not remove the wheel lug nuts by turning them to the left one turn while the wheel is still on the ground make sure you're parked on a firm level surface safely away from traffic avoid ice or slippery areas also make sure the ignition is off the hazard lights are on and the parking brake is fully set blocking both the front and rear of the wheel diagonally opposite of the jacking position is also a good idea for example if changing the right front tire block the left rear tire there are front and rear jacking locations on each side of the body the front locations are outlined by two triangular cutouts the rear locations by two rectangular cutouts do not raise the vehicle until you are sure that jack is fully engaged now you're ready to raise the vehicle by turning the jackscrew to the right raise the vehicle only until the tire just clears the surface and enough clearance is obtained to install the spare tire remember minimum tire lift provides maximum stability ok now go ahead and remove the lug nuts and wheel position the spare tire on the vehicle with the valve stem facing out the vehicle could be damaged if the spare tire is mounted incorrectly reinstall the lug nuts with the cone-shaped end toward the wheel lightly tighten the lug nuts clockwise now you can lower the vehicle by turning the jackscrew to the left and remove the jack once on the ground you can finish tightening the lug nuts alternate lug nuts until each lug nut has been tightened twice maximum effort should be used for final tightening of the lug nuts it's always a good idea to have the tightness checked with a torque wrench by your authorized dealer or at a service station now just secure the tire jack and tools in their proper locations remove blocks from the wheels and you're ready to go please refer to the instruction manuals on the owners information DVD or Jeep com / en / owners / manuals for complete details another important safety information

title: Change a Tire
content: ah in this installment what we're going to be covering is how to change a tire with the tools in your car I took the initiative and called the Ohio State Patrol on this just to find out what the safest way to do this is should you find yourself in a situation where you have a blowout on the highway most highly recommended course of action is to get off the highway completely you don't want to be doing this on the side of the road especially on a highway where people are traveling at a high rate of speed if you absolutely have to pull off the road what you want to do is get over as far to the right as possible first thing to do is to press your hazard switch that's usually located on the dashboard as a red triangle in addition to that you can purchase reflectors or road flares that you could put out just to alert other drivers that yes there is somebody with a disabled vehicle and don't hit them don't worry and if you have triple-a or you know really big boyfriend or then yeah by all means contact them and have them do it for you if you don't feel comfortable doing this but should you be in a situation where you absolutely have to do this then I would go about it this title: Change a Tire
content: hi everyone this tire had a leaky valve stem and I tried everything to get the tire off so that I could put a new valve stem in but it wasn't easy I tried beating on it with a sledge jumping up and down on it throwing it against the ground at a funny angle but the tires bead stayed firmly pressed against the rim no matter what I did but this is the way I finally managed to get the bead broken loose so that I could put a new valve stem in I put the space saver on the car in place of the problem tire and then I got a board and used it as a ramp so that I can put the cars weight on the tire and break the bead loose from the rim that board turned out to not be strong enough so we'll try again with two boards all right there's room to get that out of there and put a new valve stem in I put a little dish soap on the valve stem to make it slide into its spot a little more easily and then I tried holding it with the pliers to keep my fingers out of harm's way but that wasn't going to work so I ended up with my fingers in there anyway and then just holding it in place with the pliers now all I have to do is get the tire back on the rim this might look a little silly but it does really almost there back on the ground so okay I need to go
